key_title: Key to the genera of Alismataceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Alismataceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1994). Alismataceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Inflorescence a raceme or panicle; fruit 1- or 2-seeded, indehiscent, or if ever dehiscent (in Damasonium) then carpels radially arranged (like the spokes of a wheel); leaves ± acute
Flowers solitary on long peduncles, each arising from the axil of a membranous bract; fruit several-seeded, dehiscent; leaves rounded at apex
Flowers bisexual; carpels numerous and arranged in a single whorl; stamens 6, more or less in pairs opposite the outer perianth lobes
Flowers mostly unisexual; inflorescence with basal flowers female or bisexual, distal flowers male; carpels numerous and spirally arranged; stamens numerous
Aggregate fruit of 18–20 achenes, narrowed at base, rounded distally; each carpel with 1 ovule
Aggregate fruit of 5–6 follicles, broad at base, narrowed distally, follicles arranged like the spokes of a wheel; each carpel with 2 ovules
